channel.title: Metals Industry News Feed
channel.description: Automated news feed for aluminum, steel, copper, and nickel industries

item.title: Global Demand for Copper Surges 50% by 2040
item.description: This piece discusses how electrification, AI infrastructure, and renewable energy are set to push global copper demand up by about 50% by 2040, based largely on findings from S&P Global’s *Copper in the Age of AI* study.[6][3] It emphasizes that without major investment in mining, processing, and recycling technologies, copper could shift from being an enabler of the energy transition and digitalization to a constraint on sustainable growth.[6][3]

item.title: Nickel Plunges from Over 2-Year High as Markets Reassess Indonesian Output Cuts
item.description: Nickel futures fell to about $17,100 per tonne after briefly touching a more than two-year high of $18,875 on January 6, as traders reassessed the scale and credibility of Indonesia’s proposed 34% cut to its 2026 nickel mining quota.[2] Despite talk of curbs, Russia’s Nornickel still projects a 275,000-tonne surplus next year and LME stockpiles climbed to 255,000 tonnes in 2025, underscoring ongoing oversupply concerns.[2]

item.title: Pressure for Indonesian Quota U-Turn Is a Risk for Nickel Price Rally
item.description: Indonesia, which accounts for about 70% of global nickel production (around 3.8 million tonnes last year), has lifted prices close to 19‑month highs by announcing cuts to mining quotas aimed at boosting revenues.[5] Analysts warn the rally may be short‑lived because many new Indonesian projects are due onstream in 2026 and industry pressure could force the government to ease quotas later in the year, allowing miners to reapply for higher production permits.[5]

item.title: Hydro joins Alumobility to accelerate aluminium adoption in the automotive industry
item.description: Hydro announced it has joined **Alumobility**, a global ecosystem aimed at advancing aluminium use in lighter, more energy‑efficient and circular vehicles.[2] By contributing its low‑carbon production expertise and full value‑chain capabilities, Hydro seeks to drive innovation in lightweight, sustainable aluminium solutions for automakers worldwide.[2]

item.title: Copper Pushes Higher With Metals Set for Fourth Weekly Advance
item.description: Copper, aluminum and other industrial metals climbed again, extending a strong multi-week rally driven by tightening supplies, increased shipments to the US, and rising investor enthusiasm for commodities.[5] Nickel, tin and copper each gained more than 2% in London, with copper moving back toward its record above $13,300 a tonne set earlier in the week, as the LMEX base metals index headed for a fourth straight weekly advance.[5]

item.title: Copper rises with bets on future demand growth
item.description: Copper prices advanced on Friday and were set for a fourth consecutive week of gains, supported by renewed bets on future demand growth.[7] The move higher came alongside strength in aluminium and other base metals, as investors positioned for stronger medium-term consumption linked to industrial and energy-transition demand.[7]

item.title: Rio Tinto may buy Glencore to form mining leader with copper prices near record
item.description: Glencore and Rio Tinto announced merger talks on January 9, 2026, which could create the world's biggest mining company amid soaring metal prices. The deal follows Anglo American's acquisition of Teck Resources and comes as analysts view it as a critical moment for industry consolidation.

item.title: Nickel prices hit 15-month high on robust sentiment
item.description: Nickel prices on major exchanges climbed to a 15‑month high on 6 January, supported by strong investor sentiment linked to macroeconomic developments and possible changes to Indonesia’s mining plans.[4] LME nickel reached about $18,045/ton, up 7% day‑on‑day and roughly 20% above mid‑December levels, with SHFE nickel also hitting its daily limit.[4]

item.title: Nickel prices hit 15-month high on robust sentiment
item.description: Nickel prices climbed to a 15‑month high on strong market sentiment, supported by broader gains in base metals and expectations that Indonesian policy changes may tighten ore supply and raise production costs.[6] Market participants report that Indonesia could cut its nickel ore work plan and budget (RKAB) to 250 million tonnes in 2026 from about 379 million tonnes in 2025, even as domestic ore consumption is projected to rise, implying a potential squeeze on available ore for processing capacity.[6]

item.title: Nickel Prices Jump After Top Producer Indonesia Signals 2026 Output Cut
item.description: Indonesia announced plans to cut nickel production in 2026 to better balance global supply and demand, triggering a jump in nickel prices on the London Metal Exchange.[2] The government intends to adjust miners’ production quotas after years of rapidly rising output that lifted Indonesia’s share of global nickel production from about 31.5% in 2020 to over 60% in 2024, aiming to reduce surplus and support prices while addressing environmental concerns.[2]

item.title: Copper surges past $13,000/t as bull run gains pace
item.description: The three-month copper price closed at $13,230/t, up 3.04% on the day and 5.8% since January 2. The rally is supported by financial investors seeking safe-haven assets amid geopolitical uncertainty, with expectations of a 650,000–850,000t copper concentrate supply shortfall in 2026.

item.title: Alcoa, Ball and Unilever pioneer carbon-free aluminum packaging with ELYSIS technology
item.description: Alcoa, in partnership with Ball Corporation and Unilever, announced the first commercial use of **ELYSIS carbon-free aluminum smelting technology** in consumer aerosol packaging.[1] The can uses 50% ELYSIS primary aluminum and 50% post‑consumer recycled content, eliminating direct greenhouse gas emissions from smelting and significantly lowering the packaging’s carbon footprint.[1]

item.title: Lloyds Engineering Works Signs Technology Licensing Agreement with US-Based The Material Works
item.description: Lloyds Engineering Works has entered a strategic technology licensing partnership with U.S.-based The Material Works to deploy **EPS Generation 4** steel surface-cleaning technology.[4] The process replaces traditional acid-based pickling with an eco‑friendly system that uses recyclable materials, achieves zero effluent discharge, and eliminates hazardous acid chemicals, improving both sustainability and production efficiency in steel processing.[4]

item.title: Nickel price extends drop amid lack of detail on Indonesia output cuts
item.description: Nickel retreated from a recent 19‑month high after Indonesia failed to provide details on its pledged production cuts, which had previously driven a sharp price rally.[5] Three‑month LME nickel futures fell as much as 5.9%, settling 4.1% lower at about $17,155/ton, with analysts warning that price sustainability depends on meaningful and consistent quota reductions.[5]

item.title: Global nickel market recalibrates after explosive trading week
item.description: Following a volatile week marked by a spike above $18,000/ton, three‑month LME nickel hovered near $17,900/ton as the market reassessed the impact of Indonesia’s planned output cuts and recent speculative flows.[7] Traders reported a shift from aggressive buying to more cautious positioning, with attention focused on how firmly Jakarta will enforce reduced nickel mining quotas.[7]

item.title: Indonesia releases January (Period I) benchmark prices for nickel ore
item.description: Indonesia’s nickel miners association set the January Period I benchmark nickel ore reference price at about $14,630/wmt, a 0.21% increase from late‑December levels.[2] FOB prices for higher‑grade ore rose marginally across Ni 1.6–2.0% grades, reflecting firmer demand and the broader upswing in nickel markets.[2]

item.title: Nickel price extends drop amid lack of detail on Indonesia output cuts
item.description: Nickel prices fell sharply from a 19‑month high after Indonesia, the world’s largest nickel producer, failed to provide specifics on planned mining quota cuts that had previously driven a strong price rally.[5] The article notes that three‑month LME nickel futures, which had surged to about $18,800/t on expectations of reduced Indonesian supply, pulled back as analysts warned that any impact on global production capacity may be limited unless meaningful quota reductions are implemented and maintained.[5]

item.title: CRITICAL MINERALS CURRENTS (January 10, 2026)
item.description: A critical minerals market update notes that nickel prices have recently hit highs near $18,500/t, supported by investor sentiment and emerging supply constraints.[1] The report situates nickel within broader efforts by the United States and its allies to boost domestic production and reduce reliance on China for critical mineral refining and processing capacity.[1]

item.title: Five Copper Miners Leading the Commodity Rally as Producers Post Explosive Monthly Returns
item.description: Copper miners and producers have posted double-digit gains as investors position for infrastructure spending and energy transition demand. Companies like Freeport-McMoRan surged 26.2% over the past month, with director buying signaling confidence in continued copper demand from AI infrastructure and Trump's housing initiatives.

item.title: US raw steel production is up 2.8 percent - week 1, 2026
item.description: US domestic raw steel production for the week ending January 10, 2026, reached 1.752 million net tons, up 2.8 percent from the previous week and 3.1 percent from the same week in 2025. The capacity utilization rate was 75.7 percent, compared to 74.4 percent the prior week and 76.3 percent a year earlier. Adjusted year-to-date production through January 10 was 2.482 million net tons at 75.3 percent utilization, up 2.6 percent year-over-year.

item.title: Steel – Price, Chart, Historical Data and Market News
item.description: Steel rebar futures are trading above 3,120 CNY/ton and near multi‑month highs, supported by expectations that China will roll out new policy measures to bolster economic growth and steel demand.[1] The People’s Bank of China plans to lower the reserve requirement ratio and cut key policy rates in 2026, while current data show steel at 3,128 CNY/ton on January 9, up 0.55% on the day and 1.66% over the past month, though still slightly below year‑ago levels.[1]

item.title: China's Alumina Market: Persistent Supply Surplus Amid Production Adjustments in December 2025 and January 2026 Outlook
item.description: The article reports that China's alumina output is forecast to edge down to about 7.6 million tonnes in January 2026, with daily production slightly lower than in December as some refineries trim operating rates.[2] Despite the reduction, a persistent supply surplus is expected, with inventories staying relatively high and keeping alumina prices under pressure in the near term.[2]

item.title: Alcoa, Ball and Unilever debut carbon-free aluminium aerosol packaging
item.description: Alcoa, Ball Corporation and Unilever announced what they describe as the first-ever aerosol can made with 50% ELYSIS carbon-free primary aluminium and 50% post-consumer recycled content, launched ahead of COP30. The ELYSIS smelting process replaces carbon anodes with inert materials so that oxygen, rather than CO₂, is emitted, enabling one of the lowest‑carbon aluminium packaging solutions currently available for personal and home care products.[1]

item.title: CES Innovation Awards 2026 Honoree: Portable SSD T7 Resurrected with 100% recycled aluminum enclosure
item.description: Samsung detailed its CES 2026 Innovation Awards honoree, the Portable SSD T7 Resurrected, which features an enclosure made from 100% recycled aluminum sourced from smartphone production scrap and uses recycled paper packaging. The company frames the device as a flagship example of circular design, enabled by cross‑division collaboration, and a starting point for a broader ecosystem that reuses aluminum and other waste materials across multiple product categories.[5]

item.title: Steel Prices in the Second Week of January 2026
item.description: The Arab Iron and Steel Union reports that global iron and steel markets showed relative **price stability** in the second week of January 2026, with only limited price movements.[6] The update notes that both iron ore and finished steel products traded in a narrow range, indicating a tentative balance between supply and demand in major regions.[6]

item.title: Steel - Price, News and Market Data
item.description: Benchmark Chinese steel (rebar) prices hovered above **CNY 3,120 per ton**, near a multi‑month high as of January 9, 2026, supported by expectations of fresh economic stimulus in China.[1] Trading Economics notes that prices have risen about 1.7% over the past month but remain slightly below year‑earlier levels, with the People’s Bank of China signaling easier monetary policy that underpins the demand outlook.[1]

item.title: HRC Steel Hits Multi‑Month High as 2026 Begins
item.description: US hot‑rolled coil (HRC) steel prices rose to **around 940 USD/ton** on January 9, 2026, extending a rally that has lifted values more than 30% compared with the same period a year earlier.[2] Trading Economics highlights that HRC recently touched its highest level since April 2025, reflecting tighter supply and firmer demand in flat steel markets.[2]

item.title: U.S. crude steel production recorded an increase on an annual basis in the week ending January 3, 2026
item.description: According to American Iron and Steel Institute (AISI) data, U.S. crude steel production reached 1,704,000 net tons in the week ending January 3, 2026, up 1.4% from 1,680,000 net tons in the same week a year earlier.[1] Capacity utilization was 74.4%, slightly below 75.6% a year ago, while production rose 0.5% from the previous week’s 1,695,000 net tons and regional output was led by the South with 759,000 net tons.[1]

item.title: Nickel falls from 19-month peak as metals rally pauses
item.description: Nickel prices eased after briefly touching a 19‑month high near $18,800 per ton, as the recent broad rally in base metals paused.[3] The earlier surge was driven by concerns over reduced output from Indonesia and strong investment flows into Chinese metals markets, but three‑month LME nickel was last quoted around $18,370 per ton alongside declines in copper, aluminum, zinc, and lead.[3]

item.title: Nickel gluts to zinc deficits: LME shadow stocks tell the story
item.description: LME shadow stock data show a pronounced contrast between nickel oversupply and zinc tightness, highlighting how off‑warrant inventories shape apparent market balance.[9] The article notes that three‑month nickel recently spiked to a 19‑month high of $18,800 per ton before retreating to $17,895, underscoring how supply‑risk headlines can trigger sharp but volatile price moves in an otherwise well‑supplied nickel market.[9]

item.title: Pressure for Indonesian quota U-turn is a risk for nickel price rally
item.description: Indonesia, which accounts for about 70% of global nickel production, has pushed nickel prices to 19‑month highs by planning cuts to mining quotas, but analysts warn there is strong industry pressure for the government to reverse course.[4] Many new Indonesian nickel projects are due to come onstream in the second half of the year, and producers may seek higher quotas later, which could lift output and cap further price gains.[4]

item.title: Nickel price tumbles 4.12% as Indonesia's output remains unclear
item.description: Nickel prices on the London Metal Exchange fell more than 4% from their recent peak as uncertainty persisted over Indonesia’s 2026 production plans and output quotas.[8] Market participants are reassessing expectations for Indonesian supply, with ambiguity over approved mining volumes creating volatility in both price direction and capacity outlook.[8]

item.title: Nickel – Price, news and Indonesian output cuts
item.description: Nickel futures recently hit around $18,500 per tonne, the highest in over two years, supported by concerns over supply from Indonesia after Jakarta proposed a 34% reduction in nickel output in its 2026 budget.[1] The piece notes that Indonesia’s move, aimed at addressing oversupply and declining ore grades, could significantly tighten global production capacity even as prices remain volatile.[1]

item.title: Talon Metals completes acquisition of Eagle Mine and Humboldt Mill, creating a multi‑asset U.S. nickel‑copper company
item.description: Talon Metals has closed its acquisition of Lundin Mining’s Eagle Mine and Humboldt Mill operations in the U.S., forming a multi‑asset nickel‑copper company with an expanded domestic production base.[6] The company plans to extend mine life at Eagle, accelerate exploration in Michigan and Minnesota, and advance the Tamarack Nickel‑Copper Project and a planned battery minerals processing facility, effectively increasing future U.S. nickel capacity.[6]

item.title: TECH Project high-grade nickel is primed to fuel the global green transition
item.description: Innovation News Network reports on Queensland Pacific Metals’ TECH Project in Australia, which aims to become a major source of high‑grade, ethically derived nickel for electric vehicle and energy‑storage supply chains.[1] The project uses the DNi Process, an extraction technology designed to recycle more than 98% of nitric acid, avoid tailings dams, minimize waste, and ultimately operate as a carbon‑negative, sustainable facility.[1]

item.title: Nickel Supply Woes: Innovations Steering a Sustainable EV Future
item.description: CarbonCredits.com analyzes how high‑nickel NMC batteries are driving nickel demand and examines technological and supply‑chain innovations to keep EV growth sustainable.[2] The article highlights alternative chemistries like LFP and sodium‑ion, material innovation toward low‑nickel or nickel‑free batteries, and advanced recycling to create a more circular, resilient nickel supply chain.[2]

item.title: Nickel's role in the future of safer electric vehicle batteries
item.description: Researchers from the University of Texas at Austin and Argonne National Laboratory have conducted an extensive study on high‑nickel cathodes for EV batteries, detailing how nickel’s high energy density can be harnessed while addressing safety and stability challenges.[3] By mapping critical states of charge and understanding metal‑oxygen bond strength and surface reactivity, the work proposes guidelines for safer, more efficient nickel‑rich battery designs that support the clean‑energy transition.[3]

item.title: Copper Cables: Antitrust Launches Investigation into Alleged Cartel – Prysmian and Nexans Down on the Stock Exchange
item.description: Italy’s antitrust authority (AGCM) has opened an investigation into several major low‑voltage copper cable manufacturers in Italy, including Prysmian Cavi e Sistemi Italia, over alleged price‑fixing conduct dating back to 2005.[2] The probe, still at an early stage, triggered share price declines for Prysmian and Nexans, though analysts currently expect only a negligible impact on Prysmian given that the Italian low‑voltage copper cable market represents less than 3% of its revenues.[2]

item.title: Aluminium alloy futures fluctuate at highs, and short-term macro tailwinds boost the market
item.description: This report notes that aluminium alloy futures in China have been fluctuating at relatively high levels, supported by macroeconomic tailwinds and firm cost support.[3] SHFE data show total registered cast aluminium alloy warrant volumes around 69,922 tonnes as of January 9, 2026, indicating ample exchange stocks even as prices resume an upward trend.[3]

item.title: SHFE aluminium night session breaks through 25,000
item.description: LME aluminum closed at $3,191 per tonne, up 1.33%, with prices reaching a high of $3,200 per tonne during the session. The market continues to experience tightness driven by supply constraints in China and Europe, though demand suppression is intensifying as the Chinese New Year approaches.

item.title: Comex Copper Settles 2.21% Higher at $5.9850
item.description: Front Month Comex Copper for January delivery gained 12.95 cents per pound to $5.9850, marking the largest one-day gain since January 5, 2026. This represents the second-highest close in history and is up 6.31% month-to-date.

item.title: Global steel industry battles surplus supply, protectionism
item.description: Global steelmaking capacity is projected to reach 2.55 billion metric tons by end-2025, with a 2025 surplus of 680 million mt, exacerbated by additions in Asia and the Middle East. India anticipates producing 11.4 million mt more crude steel in 2026, aiming for 300 million mt capacity by 2030 amid weakening prices. Protectionist measures, like US 50% steel tariffs, intensify challenges for Europe and global trade.

item.title: Copper in the Age of AI: Challenges of Electrification
item.description: S&P Global's comprehensive study projects global copper demand will rise 50% to 42 million metric tons by 2040 from 28 million metric tons in 2025, driven by electrification, renewable energy, data centers, and AI infrastructure. The report identifies a potential 10 million metric ton shortfall by 2040 without significant supply expansion and emphasizes that copper has become essential to technological progress and economic growth. The analysis highlights the need for multilateral cooperation, regional diversification, and innovation across the entire copper value chain to ensure a resilient supply system.

item.title: LME Nickel Prices Surge Toward $17,900 on Weaker US Dollar
item.description: London Metal Exchange nickel futures rose by $185 on January 12, nearing the $17,900 level after a two-day increase. This reflects continued strength in nickel prices driven by macroeconomic factors and currency movements.

item.title: SunSirs: Last Week, Nickel Prices Rose Initially and Then Fell (January 5-9)
item.description: Nickel prices fluctuated last week, rising initially due to Indonesia's planned 34% cut in nickel ore production quotas for 2026, then falling. Refined nickel production in China is expected to decrease month-on-month, narrowing short-term surplus amid abundant overall supply.

item.title: SMM January 13 News: Aluminum Ingot and Billet Warehouse Outflows Increase
item.description: According to SMM statistics, outflows from warehouses of aluminum ingots reached 149,000 mt last week, an increase compared to prior periods. This indicates rising demand or movement in aluminum inventories. The update highlights shifts in aluminum ingot and billet stocks as of January 13.

item.title: Aluminum Inventory Update: Social Stocks Decline While Billet Stocks Rise
item.description: SMM reports changes in aluminum inventories as of January 13, with social stocks declining and billet stocks rising. This follows a decline in alumina raw material prices, leading to expected month-on-month decreases in total aluminum costs for January. The update reflects ongoing dynamics in aluminum supply and production costs.

item.title: January US ferrous scrap seen $20-30/gt up as mills raise early 2026 offers
item.description: January US ferrous scrap prices are expected to rise by $20-30/gt as mills increase early 2026 offers. Northeast busheling scrap could settle near $370-390/gt, up $30/gt, while shredded grades are also projected higher. This reflects ongoing market adjustments into the new year.

item.title: North EU HRC futures firming on CME
item.description: CME north EU hot-rolled coil (HRC) futures prices increased, with second-quarter strips trading at €676/t and further appetite noted. March material traded at €663-665/t, driven by supply constraints and firmer sentiment in the EU steel market. Strength may also stem from rallies in Chinese coking coal futures.

item.title: The TEX Report - January 13, 2026
item.description: The daily report covers steel market updates, including stainless steel scrap import volumes and LME prices for Ni, Co, and Mo as of early January 2026. It notes prices rose 13-14% from the prior month in some segments. This provides insights into raw material trends affecting steel production.

item.title: Cleveland-Cliffs Steelton plant to officially close early 2026
item.description: Cleveland-Cliffs announced the permanent closure of its Steelton plant, following months after the company idled the facility with 500 layoffs. The closure decision was driven by weak demand and insufficient pricing for products produced at the facility.

item.title: Domestic Iron and Steel Industry Urges Congress to Maintain Buy America in Upcoming Transportation Bill
item.description: The domestic iron and steel industry is advocating for Congress to maintain Buy America provisions in the upcoming transportation bill.

item.title: Codelco expects to lift copper output by 10 000 t this year
item.description: Chilean state-run miner Codelco plans to produce 1.344 million metric tons of copper in 2026, an increase of about 10,000 tons from the previous year. This output lift reflects efforts to boost production capacity.

item.title: MAX RESOURCE ENTERS MASTERS SERVICES AGREEMENT
item.description: Max Resource Corp. entered a masters services agreement, highlighting its Serra Azul Copper-Silver Project in Colombia along the Andean copper belt. The project is fully funded by Freeport-McMoRan up to $50 million for an 80% earn-in, validating its geological potential amid global copper supply discussions.

item.title: Why are commodity prices going crazy?
item.description: The nickel price has risen 26% in one month and 13% year over year, signaling a recovery after a three-year slump due to Indonesian oversupply. Improving demand from Chinese stainless steel mills and EV battery producers supports the rebound, amid supply uncertainty from Indonesia's potential 34% output cut in 2026.

item.title: [1.14 Nickel Morning Meeting Summary] SMM battery-grade nickel sulphate price stays flat WoW
item.description: On January 13, the SMM battery-grade nickel sulphate index price held steady at 26423 yuan/mt. The quotation range remained flat week-over-week amid ongoing market monitoring.

item.title: Nickel price spikes more than 10% as Chinese buying fuels metals surge
item.description: Nickel prices spiked over 10% to $18,785 a ton on the LME, the biggest gain in over three years, driven by Chinese investor buying and risks to Indonesian supply. This extends a 30% rise since mid-December, reversing oversupply issues despite weaker EV battery demand.

item.title: Metals - Nickel: supportive macro-backdrop to further boost LME price
item.description: LME nickel trades at ~US$18k/t, a 19-month high, driven by Indonesia's plan to cut FY26F RKAB quota. Supportive macro factors are expected to further elevate prices.

item.title: Indonesia quota talk triggers nickel reality check
item.description: Nickel prices surged on speculation of Indonesia slashing 2026 ore quotas by a third to 250 million tonnes, potentially removing 700,000 tonnes of supply and flipping the market to deficit. However, a massive 20,760-tonne LME warranting on Jan. 7 highlighted ongoing oversupply, pulling prices back from $18,800. Processing capacity constraints outside China limit quick responses from new mines.

item.title: Weiming to trial second nickel matte line at Indonesia's Jiaman project
item.description: Weiming plans to trial a second nickel matte production line at its Jiaman project in Indonesia. This expansion aims to boost nickel processing capacity at the site.

item.title: Strengthening nickel resources, MBMA spends IDR 44.37 billion
item.description: MBMA invested IDR 44.37 billion to complete 1,659 drill holes at the SCM Mine, upgrading the status of its nickel resources. This effort strengthens the company's nickel asset base.

item.title: The 2026 Aluminum Squeeze: Why This Industrial Metal is Outperforming the S&P 500
item.description: A structural price squeeze grips the global aluminum market as of mid-January 2026, driven by supply bottlenecks including Guinea's bauxite processing shift and China's 45 million tonne production ceiling. Chinese exports fell 9% in late 2025 amid domestic green economy demand. Future scenarios include potential demand destruction above $3,200/tonne or relief from Russian supply if sanctions ease.

item.title: HRC Steel - Price - Chart - Historical Data - News
item.description: HRC Steel fell to 942 USD/T on January 13, 2026, down 0.11% from the previous day. Over the past month, prices have risen 3.86%, and are up 33.24% compared to the same time last year. Forecasts indicate trading at 959.80 USD/T by quarter-end and 1032.31 USD/T in 12 months.

item.title: Sherritt-Canada's Nickel Mines in Cuba Need Oil to Operate
item.description: Sherritt's nickel mining operations in Cuba rely on Venezuelan oil supplies. Disruptions to this oil could impact production capacity at these mines.

item.title: Nickel prices surge on Indonesia output-cut news… highest in 15 months
item.description: Nickel futures on the LME settled at $17,681/t following Indonesia's announcement to cut output this year. While prices have risen 25.3% over the past month, analysts caution that further gains may be limited until concrete implementation details emerge, and supply resumption from the Philippines in March could ease the current price uptrend.

item.title: CBAM starts in January 2026, with limited aluminium impact until Q1
item.description: The EU's Carbon Border Adjustment Mechanism (CBAM) begins in January 2026, pricing carbon on imports like aluminum to support EU industries. Aluminum supply disruptions are expected to remain muted through Q1, with potential shifts from April.

item.title: Paragon Union-Japan's Asahi Seiren to tap RM648b recycled aluminium market
item.description: Paragon Union and Japan's Asahi Seiren partner to enter the RM648b recycled aluminum market. Recycled aluminum production uses just 5% of the energy required for primary production and cuts greenhouse gas emissions by up to 95%. This addresses key sustainability challenges in the industry.

item.title: US raw steel production is up 2.8 percent - week 1, 2026
item.description: US domestic raw steel production for the week ending January 10, 2026, reached 1.752 million net tons with a capacity utilization rate of 75.7 percent, up 2.8 percent from the prior week. This marks a 3.1 percent increase from the same week in 2025. Year-to-date production through January 10 is up 2.6 percent from last year.

item.title: Fujitsu launches demonstration experiment into green steel value flow utilizing blockchain technology to accelerate decarbonization in the steel Industry
item.description: Fujitsu has started a demonstration experiment on green steel value flow using blockchain, selected by Japan's METI for its FY2025 project, running from December 2025 to February 2026. The initiative ensures secure distribution of environmental value data, like emissions reduction certificates, across steel supply chains via CO2 reduction expertise and data platforms. It addresses challenges in propagating green steel's benefits downstream to promote decarbonization.

item.title: Signal Group Spotlight: Steel Seaborne Trends
item.description: The start of 2026 is expected to feature a seasonal dip in steel production due to Chinese New Year holidays, impacting exports with weaker Q1 volumes. This trend follows historical patterns of reduced activity during the holiday period.

item.title: Fujitsu launches demonstration experiment into green steel value flow utilizing blockchain technology to accelerate decarbonization in the steel industry
item.description: Fujitsu has commenced a demonstration experiment into green steel value flow using blockchain technology, running from December 2025 to February 2026. The project, selected by Japan's Ministry of Economy, Trade and Industry (METI), aims to ensure environmental value and transaction confidentiality are secured across steel supply chains while exploring mechanisms for green steel information distribution.

item.title: Driving innovation at Escondida
item.description: BHP's Escondida copper mine in Chile has achieved full autonomy at its Escondida Norte pit, operating 33 autonomous trucks and 11 autonomous drills that move over 350,000 tonnes of material daily. The autonomous zone now accounts for 30% of Escondida's production and has trained over 5,000 workers in new technologies while maintaining 64% female participation in autonomy-related roles. These innovations enhance safety, productivity, and sustainability while positioning the world's largest copper producer to meet growing global demand driven by electrification and renewable energy.

item.title: SMM Nickel Midday Review - Nickel Prices Continued to Rise
item.description: SMM #1 refined nickel prices averaged 146,450 yuan/mt on January 14, up 1,250 yuan/mt from the previous trading day. The most-traded SHFE nickel contract closed at 143,160 yuan/mt, up 1.47%, amid a tug-of-war between strong expectations for Indonesian policies and weak demand fundamentals. The market is expected to remain volatile within a 128,000-145,000 yuan/mt range.

item.title: From volume to value: 5 strategic pillars to reform Indonesia's nickel downstream processing
item.description: Transisi Bersih held a briefing on January 14, 2026, outlining five strategic pillars for reforming Indonesia's nickel downstream processing. The focus shifts from maximizing volume to enhancing value in nickel production. This addresses sustainability and efficiency in capacity utilization.

item.title: Steel Market Update
item.description: The Steel Market Update provides the latest pricing, trends, and industry news for flat-rolled steel, including assessments on scrap and futures. It features real-time price tracking, sentiment surveys, inventory levels, and demand analysis for sectors like construction and automotive. Businesses use it to anticipate market shifts.

item.title: The TEX Report - January 15, 2026
item.description: Vietnam's FHS raised domestic HRC prices for March shipments by $7–8. China's 2025 steel exports reached a record 119 million tonnes, with a high monthly average. The daily report covers key steel market developments.

item.title: A North of 60 copper supply solution
item.description: The article discusses upcoming copper mining projects in the Golden Triangle region, including Galore Creek, KSM, and Schaft Creek, which are poised to significantly boost annual copper production capacity in the area north of 60 degrees latitude.

item.title: SMM #1 refined nickel average price update
item.description: On January 15, the SMM #1 refined nickel average price stood at 150,050 yuan/mt, up 3,600 yuan/mt from the previous day, reflecting continued strength in nickel prices amid recent market developments.

item.title: [SMM Nickel Midday Review] Nickel Prices Surged Sharply on January 15
item.description: On January 15, 2026, SMM #1 refined nickel prices rose sharply to an average of 150,050 yuan/mt, up 3,600 yuan/mt from the previous day, amid central bank liquidity measures. The SHFE nickel futures contract gained 3.04%, closing at 145,280 yuan/mt in the morning session. Market dynamics reflect ongoing tension between Indonesian policy expectations and high inventory realities.

item.title: Indonesia may approve nickel ore production quota of around 260 mln tons in 2026, local media says
item.description: Indonesia is considering approving a nickel ore production quota of approximately 260 million tons for 2026. This follows discussions on curbing output to support prices amid global market shifts. The quota aims to balance supply with value maximization strategies.

item.title: Ontario fast-tracks Crawford nickel project
item.description: Ontario is accelerating the Crawford nickel project, described as the Western world's largest nickel sulphide mine. The initiative includes building a new nickel processing plant and downstream alloy production to create a fully domestic supply chain. This aims to bolster Canada's critical minerals leadership.

item.title: Ontario fast-tracks Crawford nickel project
item.description: The Ontario government is prioritizing the Crawford nickel project in 2026 to unlock one of the world's largest nickel deposits. This move is intended to boost the economy and support secure nickel supply chains. It emphasizes full domestic production from mining to processing.

item.title: Nickel Industries Growth Shares: Strategic Investment Opportunity in 2026
item.description: Nickel Industries is highlighted as a strategic investment pick for 2026 growth shares. The article positions the company amid rising nickel market opportunities. It focuses on potential expansion in production capacity.

item.title: Major steel and raw material futures prices in China - January 15, 2026
item.description: Rebar futures at Shanghai Futures Exchange closed at RMB 3,160/mt ($451/mt) on January 15, 2026. Other steel products like HRC listed with weekly changes; iron ore down 0.73%, scrap up 0.88%. Turkish rebar index up 0.17%, reflecting mixed regional trends.

item.title: Coolbrook Named on the 2026 Global Cleantech 100
item.description: Coolbrook has been recognized on the 2026 Global Cleantech 100 for its RotoDynamic Technology, which replaces fossil fuel burning in heavy industries like iron and steel with electrification. The technology's RotoDynamic Reactor and Heater achieve temperatures up to 1700°C for carbon-free production, potentially cutting 2.4 billion tons of annual CO2 emissions. It supports rapid decarbonization in steel, cement, and chemicals sectors.

item.title: Rio Tinto and Amazon Web Services collaborate to bring low-carbon Nuton copper to U.S. data centres
item.description: Rio Tinto and Amazon Web Services have partnered to deploy Nuton copper technology at U.S. data centers. The technology is projected to use substantially less water and generate lower carbon emissions than conventional concentrator-based copper production methods.

item.title: Vale Indonesia secures mining quota approval for 2026
item.description: Nickel miner PT Vale Indonesia has secured approval for its 2026 mining quota, allowing all operational activities to return to normal. The company did not disclose the specific volume of nickel ore permitted for production this year.

item.title: This week, the macro cycle rebounded, aluminum | SMM - Metal News
item.description: This week, macroeconomic cycles rebounded, leading to unexpected destocking in aluminum inventories. Aluminum prices showed a steady rise as a result. The report highlights positive momentum in the aluminum market.

item.title: January 16, 2026, Jinshi Futures Morning Report: The Trump Administration
item.description: China Iron and Steel Association reports key steel enterprises produced 19.97 million tons of crude steel in early January, up 21.6% from prior period, estimating national daily output at 2.48 million tons. Mysteel data shows rebar production at 1.903 million tons for week ending January 15, down 0.39%, while apparent demand rose 8.79%. LME base metals mostly declined amid ferrous metals updates.

item.title: Business Intelligence Group Honors Axalta with Six BIG Innovation Awards
item.description: Axalta received awards for coatings innovations enhancing sustainability in automotive and industrial applications, including electrical steel coatings for efficient electric motors. Technologies like Lumeera 3250 low-bake clearcoat reduce CO2 emissions by at least 20% per vehicle by curing at lower temperatures. Other solutions offer energy savings up to 40%, zero VOCs, and high transfer efficiency for cabinet coatings.

item.title: Capstone Copper Achieves Production Guidance
item.description: Capstone Copper reported record 2025 copper production of 224,764 tonnes, exceeding guidance and up 22% from 2024. Growth was driven by the Mantoverde Development Project and Mantos Blancos debottlenecking, with a record quarterly output of 58,273 tonnes in December. Despite a strike, Mantoverde operates at 75% capacity, and shares surged post-announcement.

item.title: Why Capstone Copper, Catalyst Metals, DroneShield, and Wildcat shares are rising today
item.description: Capstone Copper achieved its FY 2025 production guidance with record 224,764 tonnes of copper, up 22% year-over-year due to key project executions. CEO Cashel Meagher highlighted transformational growth from catalysts like Mantoverde. Shares rose 7.5% following the announcement.

item.title: First Quantum backs Panama's plan to allow stockpile processing at shut copper mine
item.description: First Quantum Minerals supports Panama's plan to process stockpiles at the shut Cobre Panama copper mine. The company awaits formal approvals to coordinate activities with the government. This could enable some production resumption from existing materials.

item.title: [SMM Nickel Midday Review] Nickel Prices Experienced a Significant Correction on January 16
item.description: On January 16, SMM #1 refined nickel prices ranged from 144,700-154,000 yuan/mt, averaging 149,350 yuan/mt, down 700 yuan/mt from the previous day. Spot premiums for Jinchuan #1 refined nickel averaged 6,500 yuan/mt, down 1,500 yuan/mt. The SHFE nickel contract (2602) closed the morning session at 142,540 yuan/mt, down 3.19%, amid central bank rate cuts.

item.title: [SMM Nickel Flash] January 16 — Supply side, upstream offers remained at 1,050-1,100 yuan/mtu
item.description: On January 16, upstream offers for nickel remained stable at 1,050-1,100 yuan/mtu, with some iron plants holding firm. A price hike failed to boost demand, as cautious sentiment persists in the market.

item.title: In Case You Missed It - BC Extra Upgrades & Downgrades - 16-01-26
item.description: Canaccord Genuity upgrades Nickel Industries Limited to Buy, raising the target to $1.05 from $0.80 due to higher nickel price forecasts and base metals strength. The broker expects weaker nickel prices to impact EBITDA but sees upside from revised metal price outlooks, including copper.

item.title: Nickel and cobalt out, CO2 in at Turnagain
item.description: The Turnagain nickel-cobalt project is shifting focus from nickel and cobalt production to CO2 sequestration. Details on the operational changes at the site were reported in the latest update.

item.title: First Quantum Minerals Announces 2025 Preliminary Production and 2026-2028 Guidance
item.description: First Quantum Minerals released preliminary 2025 production figures and provided guidance for nickel and other metals through 2028. The announcement details expected output capacities in U.S. dollars.

item.title: GT reassesses Finnish nickel-PGM project
item.description: GT Resources is reassessing its Kaukua nickel-PGM project in Finland by analyzing over 4,600 historic pulps and 500 infill samples to standardize data. The program aims to update resource estimates ahead of potential development.

item.title: Acciaierie d'Italia to start preferential negotiations with Azerbaijani consortium on acquisition of former Ilva plants
item.description: Extraordinary commissioners of Acciaierie d’Italia and ILVA in extraordinary administration have requested authorization from Italy’s Ministry of Enterprises and Made in Italy to begin preferential negotiations with an Azerbaijani consortium (Baku Steel Company CJSC and Azerbaijan Investment Company OJSC) for the sale of the former Ilva steel plants.[8] Ten proposals had been received by the January 10 deadline, and the chosen consortium was selected based on criteria including financial stability, industrial sustainability, and expected benefits for employment and local communities.[8]
